1.brief: Asaph, the name of three Israelites, and of the family of the first
to broaden out the ear (with the hand), i.e. (by implication) to listen
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to

properly, a pithy maxim, usually of metaphorical nature; hence, a simile (as an adage, poem, discourse)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to gush forth; figuratively, to utter (good or bad words); specifically, to emit (a foul odor)
a puzzle, hence, a trick, conundrum, sententious maxim
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
the front, of place (absolutely, the fore part, relatively the East) or time (antiquity); often used adverbially (before, anciently, eastward)

to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate

to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy

properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
a signal (literally or figuratively), as aflag, beacon, monument, omen, prodigy, evidence, etc.
a miracle; by implication, a token or omen

44.brief: to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)
a channel, e.g. a fosse, canal, shaft; specifically the Nile, as the one river of Egypt, including its collateral trenches; also the Tigris, as the main river of Assyria
to drip, or shed by trickling
properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest

45.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
to decay, i.e. (causatively) ruin (literally or figuratively)

46.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
produce, i.e. a crop or (figuratively) wealth
toil; hence, a work, produce, property (as the result of labor)

47.brief: a vine (as twining), especially the grape

48.brief: to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
something bought, i.e. property, but only livestock; abstractly, acquisition
a live coal; by analogy lightning; figuratively, an arrow, (as flashing through the air); specifically, fever

49.brief: to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
strictly froth at the mouth, i.e. (figuratively) fury (especially of God's displeasure with sin)
tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival:
a mission, i.e. (abstractly and favorable) release, or (concretely and unfavorable) an army
a messenger; specifically, of God, i.e. an angel (also a prophet, priest or teacher)
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)

50.brief: properly, to roll flat, i.e. prepare (a road); also to revolve, i.e. weigh (mentally)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to shut up; figuratively, to surrender

51.brief: to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
the first, in place, time, order or rank (specifically, a firstfruit)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
Cham, a son of Noah; also (as a patronymic) his descendants or their country

52.brief: properly, to pull up, especially the tent-pins, i.e. start on ajourney
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to drive forth (a person, an animal or chariot), i.e. lead, carry away; reflexively, to proceed (i.e. impel or guide oneself); also (from the panting induced by effort), to sigh
a pasture (i.e. open field, whither cattle are driven); by implication, a desert; also speech (including its organs)

53.brief: to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
properly, a place of refuge; abstract, safety, both the fact (security) and the feeling (trust); often (adverb with or without preposition) safely
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be startled (by a sudden alarm); hence, to fear in general
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
properly, to plump, i.e. fill up hollows; by implication, to cover (for clothing or secrecy)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south

54.brief: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, a cord (as twisted), i.e. (by implication) a boundary; by extension the territory inclosed
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to erect, i.e. create; by extension, to procure, especially by purchase (causatively, sell); by implication to own
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

55.brief: to drive out from a possession; especially to expatriate or divorce
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)

a rope (as twisted), especially a measuring line; by implication, a district or inheritance (as measured); or a noose (as of cords); figuratively, a company (as if tied together); also a throe (especially of parturition); also ruin
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

56.brief: to test; by implication, to attempt
to be (causatively, make) bitter (or unpleasant); (figuratively) to rebel (or resist; causatively, to provoke)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.

57.brief: properly, to flinch, i.e. (by implication) to go back, literally (to retreat) or figuratively (to apostatize)
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
a bow, forshooting (hence, figuratively, strength) or the iris

58.brief: to trouble; by implication, to grieve, rage, be indignant
to be (causatively, make) zealous, i.e. (in a bad sense) jealous or envious

59.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, vehemence, i.e. (with or without preposition) vehemently; by implication, wholly, speedily, etc. (often with other words as an intensive or superlative; especially when repeated)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

60.brief: properly, to pound, i.e. smite; by implication (as if beating out, and thus expanding) to disperse; also, to thrust off, down, out or upon (inclusively, reject, let alone, permit, remit, etc.)
a residence (including a shepherd's hut, the lair of animals, figuratively, the grave; also the Temple); specifically, the Tabernacle (properly, its wooden walls)
a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

61.brief: to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
exiled; captured; as noun, exile (abstractly or concretely and collectively); by extension, booty
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
ornament (abstractly or concretely, literally or figuratively)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)

62.brief: to shut up; figuratively, to surrender
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)

63.brief: properly, selected, i.e. a youth (often collective)
a virgin (from her privacy); sometimes (by continuation) a bride; also (figuratively) a city or state
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify

64.brief: literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
a widow; also a desolate place
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

65.brief: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)

66.brief: to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)
the hinder part; hence (adverb) behind, backward; also (as facing north) the West
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)

67.brief: a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
Joseph, the name of seven Israelites
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select

properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan
Jehudah (or Judah), the name of five Israelites; also of the tribe descended from the first, and of its territory
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)
Tsijon (as a permanent capital), a mountain of Jerusalem
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

69.brief: a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
a consecrated thing or place, especially, a palace, sanctuary (whether of Jehovah or of idols) or asylum
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to set (literally or figuratively); intensively, to found; reflexively, to sit down together, i.e. settle, consult
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

70.brief: properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
David, the youngest son of Jesse
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
a collective name for a flock (of sheep or goats); also figuratively (of men)

71.brief: properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, something inherited, i.e. (abstractly) occupancy, or (concretely) an heirloom; generally an estate, patrimony or portion

72.brief: to tend a flock; i.e. pasture it; intransitively, to graze (literally or figuratively); generally to rule; by extension, to associate with (as a friend)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
intelligence; by implication, an argument; by extension, caprice
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
